column4: hi. i'm getting the following error: 'E: dpkg was interrupted, you must manually run 'sudo dpkg --configure -a' to correct the problem.' Can someone help me?
what happens if you do as it says?
i will be happy to uninstall vidalia to make it work again.
if you need to navigate that you can use TAB and ENTER to select stuff
yes. that worked. what a relief! thank u sooo much. :) cheers.
then run:  ccsm   and you can set it up there
then your software will be backed up
I suggest you delete Maverick and install Precise in it's place
ok so Ubuntu is in it's own partition?
then run a final backup of the stuff you need from Maverick and boot to Windows. Delete the Linux partitions and then boot to Precise liveCD and install to the new free space
not sure about the humblebundle dude. You will need to redownload all your software and such
obviously the packages will need reinstalling as not only will they be at different versions, they will be compiled for a much later released
yes it will all need reinstalling after the clean install
